revision.comment: /* top */clean up, replaced: hynix → SK hynix, SK SK hynix → SK hynix
revision.text:
{{Infobox Embedded System |image1 = Linksys_WRT54G-02.jpg |image1_size = 200px |caption = Wireless-G Broadband Router |caption2 = |pp = |sp = http://support.linksys.com/en-us/support/lbc/WRT54G |dl = |fandom = Linksys_WRT54G_v6.0 |wikidevi = Linksys_WRT54G_v6.0 |wikipedia = |ddwrtsupport = Supported |openwrtsupport = no2mb |tomatosupport = no2mb |gargoylesupport = Incompatible |brand = Linksys |model = WRT54G |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = v6.0 |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = 06/23/2010 |page_start_origon = https://infodepot.fandom.com/wiki/Linksys_WRT54G_v6.0 |wlclass = G54 |series = WRT54G |type = wireless router |sernum = CDFD |fcc_id = Q87-WT54GV60 |icid = 3839A-WT54GV60 |us_id = |boardid = |ecc_id = |cpu1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM5352E;BCM5352EKFBG, RN0644 P10, 801483 B3; |cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS |cpu1_type_rev = BMIPS3300 (R1) |cpu1spd = 200 |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = Parallel |fla1_num = |fla1chip = Spansion;S29AL016D90TFI01;or Samsung 610 K8D1716UTC P107; |flash1size = 2 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 8 |ram1chip = SK hynix;HY57V641620ETP-H;or Samsung 619 K4S641632H-UC75; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = 32 |eth_cpu = true |sw_cpu = true |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 100MbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = IEEE 802.3/3u |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = 00:18:39, 00:18:F8 |oui = 00:18:39, 00:18:F8 |bootwait = |stockbootloader = BSP;;; |stockos = VxWorks;;; |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 0.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = yes,, 10-pin header,, unpopulated,, (115200 8N1) |jtag = yes,, 12-pin header,, unpopulated |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = 2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE2528L;SiGe, 2528L, 617CL;1; |802dot11_protocols = bg |defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = linksys |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = CyberTAN |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |tpfirmware = DD-WRT |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = 7.32" x 1.89" x 6.06" |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1chip2 = Broadcom;BCM2050;BCM2050KMLG, TS0646 P11, 801807 1; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = RP-TNC |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = 9 |rad1cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== The stock firmware on these devices contains VxWorks, not Linux. See the [[#Flashing|Linksys v5.0, v5.1, and v6.0 bellow]] for instructions on flashing the units with DD-WRT. "3763-14140704R" is silkscreened on the board. The devices can be configured with SecureEasySetup. Being configured this way, the devices will assume SSIDs of '''linksys_SES_XXXXX''' where '''XXXXX''' appears to be a random number. Before being configured, but after the SES button is pressed, the device assumes an SSID of '''linksys_OW_XXXXX''' where '''XXXXX''' is a random number. ==Links of Interest== *[http://www.linksys.com/us/support-article?articleNum=148648 Downloads (US)] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linksys_WRT54G_series WRT54G series on Wikipedia] *[http://wiki.openwrt.org/oldwiki/openwrtdocs/hardware/linksys/wrt54g WRT54G page on the OpenWrt wiki] *[[TechInfoDepot:DD-WRT/Version 5 And 6 Router Information|Version 5 And 6 Router Information]] *[http://downloads.linksys.com/downloads/datasheet/wrt54gv8-ds.pdf Datasheet.pdf] *[http://downloads.linksys.com/downloads/quickinstall/1224638367420/WRT54G-v1.1_qi.pdf Quick Install.pdf] *[http://downloads.linksys.com/downloads/userguide/WRT54G_UG_WEB_20070529.pdf User Guide.pdf] ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} *[[dd-wrt-wiki:Linksys WRT54G v5.0 & 5.1 & 6.0|Linksys WRT54G v6.0]] - Source Supported by dd-wrt as of = ? {{Dd-wrt54g5-6 flash}} ==Upgrading== {{Upgrade dd-wrt}} ==Reverting== ===Reverting to OEM Firmware from DD-WRT=== To get back to VxWorks (default firmware) you need special instructions. http://www.bitsum.com/openwiking/owbase/ow.asp?WRT54G5%5FCFE#h13
http://www.scorpiontek.org/portal/content/view/31/36/ ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===JTAG=== ====JTAG Pinouts==== 
 nTRST   1o o2	GND
   TDI   3o o4	GND
   TDO   5o o6	GND
   TMS   7o o8	GND
   TCK   9o o10	GND
 nSRST  11o o12  N/C
'''Using [[TechInfoDepot:JTAG/TIAO/Universal JTAG User Manual (Parallel)|Universal JTAG Adapter]]''' 
 white    1o o2	 black
   red    3o o4	 GND
  blue    5o o6	 GND
 green    7o o8	 GND
 yelow    9o o10  GND
 orange  11o o12  N/C
====DD-WRT JTAG Recovery==== * /noemw /nocwd switches required # Backup CFE x2 (Compare the files, they must match exactly or there is something wrong with your JTAG setup) # Erase Wholeflash x2 # Flash CFE # Unplug Power # Unplug JTAG Cable [[TechInfoDepot:DD-WRT/TFTP flash#Linksys TFTP GUI|TFTP]]: # Set Rig ip static 192.168.1.10 # Plug network cable from rig to port 1 # Get TFTP ready, server ip - 192.168.1.1, Password - blank, file - [ftp://dd-wrt.com/others/eko/BrainSlayer-V24-preSP2/08-12-10-r14929/broadcom/dd-wrt.v24_micro_generic.bin dd-wrt.v24_micro_generic.bin] # Plug in power # As soon as windows says "connected" hit upgrade. May have to use a network hub to make sure windows is always connected. # Hard Reset 30\30\30 ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== 
 VCC  1 o o 2  VCC
 TX1  3 o o 4  TX0
 RX1  5 o o 6  RX0
 N/C  7 o o 8  N/C
 GND  9 o o 10 GND
====DD-WRT Serial Recovery==== {{Modified redhawk0 instructions|wrt54gv6}} ==vlan Info== ===DD-WRT vlan Info=== *[[TechInfoDepot:DD-WRT/VLAN Support]] Confirmed the WRT54G v6.0 supports port-based vlans via the GUI. Confirmed the WRT54G v6.0 supports port-based vlans via nvram with micro-plus-SSH. WRT54G v6.0's ports are mapped like this: 1 2 3 4 | case labels 3 2 1 0 | nvram port numbers ====Defaults==== 
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram show | grep vlan.ports
vlan1ports=4 5
vlan0ports=3 2 1 0 5*
size: 19179 bytes (13589 left)
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram show | grep port.vlans
port5vlans=0 1 16
port4vlans=0
port3vlans=0
port2vlans=0
port1vlans=0
port0vlans=1
size: 19179 bytes (13589 left)
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram show | grep vlan.hwname
vlan1hwname=et0
vlan0hwname=et0
size: 19179 bytes (13589 left)
root@DD-WRT:~# lsmod
Module                  Size  Used by
ip_nat_pptp             2192   0 (unused)
ip_conntrack_pptp       2524   1
ip_nat_proto_gre        1552   0 (unused)
ip_conntrack_proto_gre    2312   0 [ip_nat_pptp ip_conntrack_pptp]
switch-robo             5036   0 (unused)
switch-core             5984   0 [switch-robo]
root@DD-WRT:~# ls /proc/switch
eth0
root@DD-WRT:~# cat /proc/switch/eth0/vlan/0/ports
0       1       2       3       5t*
root@DD-WRT:~# cat /proc/switch/eth0/vlan/1/ports
4       5t
root@DD-WRT:~# cat /proc/switch/eth0/vlan/2/ports
4
root@DD-WRT:~#
====Commands==== 
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram set vlan1ports="3 4 5"
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram set vlan0ports="2 1 0 5*"
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram commit
root@DD-WRT:~# reboot
====nvram==== 
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram show | grep vlan.ports
vlan1ports=3 4 5
vlan0ports=2 1 0 5*
size: 19303 bytes (13465 left)
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram show | grep port.vlans
port5vlans=0 1 16
port4vlans=0
port3vlans=0
port2vlans=0
port1vlans=0
port0vlans=1
size: 19303 bytes (13465 left)
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram show | grep vlan.hwname
vlan1hwname=et0
vlan0hwname=et0
size: 19303 bytes (13465 left)
root@DD-WRT:~#
====GUI==== 
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram show | grep vlan.ports
vlan0ports=3 2 1 0 5*
vlan1ports=4 5
size: 17470 bytes (15298 left)
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram show | grep port.vlans
port5vlans=0 1 16
port3vlans=0 18 19
port1vlans=0 18 19
port4vlans=1 18 19
size: 17470 bytes (15298 left)
port2vlans=0 18 19
port0vlans=1 18 19
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram show | grep vlan.hwname
vlan1hwname=et0
size: 17470 bytes (15298 left)
vlan0hwname=et0
root@DD-WRT:~#

{{FCCID Q87-WT54GV60}} ==Notes== ===DD-WRT Notes=== Also see this page: [[TechInfoDepot:DD-WRT/Version 5 And 6 Router Information|Version 5 And 6 Router Information]] There is good information at the scorpiontek site: http://www.scorpiontek.org/portal/content/view/27/36 A CFE compressor is available for the Gv5.0,5.1, and 6.0. It enables micro_plus to be put on the router. Click [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=38844 here]. [[Category:English Documentation]]
